attributes.action: Stagger or delay the reopening of schools in September 2020
attributes.additional_details:
The Gov claims of no impact to children is unfounded, they are not following the WHO guidelines, mistakes can be made but cannot be erased, no Gov wants to be remembered for its' mistakes.

There is evidence across the world where schools have reopened after infection levels have subsided & they have increased again upon reopening, Israel is a current example. 

And finally because parents should not be penalised if they feel their school has NOT done enough to protect their children.
attributes.background:
Conduct consultation with parents before making attendance mandatory or issuing penalties

Make masks mandatory in schools & not object to parents wishes for a child to wearing a mask

Where social distancing cannot be forced at a school they must be allowed to stagger pupils

rejection.details:
We think these petitions cover the issues you want to raise

Require schools to allow children to wear face masks at school due to Covid-19
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331468

Mandatory for children aged 11 and above to wear face masks whilst at school.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331826

No prosecution for parents that remove child from school during a pandemic.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399
